holidays.name: World Day of Social Justice
holidays.description: A day dedicated to promoting efforts to tackle issues such as poverty, exclusion, and unemployment, aiming to create a fairer world.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2007 to encourage social justice ideals globally.
holidays.funFact: The concept of social justice dates back to the 19th century, but this day reminds us it's still very much needed today.

holidays.name: Love Your Pet Day
holidays.description: A fun day to shower your furry, scaly, or feathery friends with extra love and attention!
holidays.origin: An unofficial pet appreciation day to promote pet adoption and responsible pet ownership.
holidays.funFact: On this day, pet stores often report a spike in sales of treats and toys as owners pamper their companions.

holidays.name: National Cherry Pie Day
holidays.description: A delicious holiday to celebrate the classic American dessert beloved for its sweet, tart cherry filling.
holidays.origin: An American food holiday with unclear origins, but enjoyed nationwide by pie enthusiasts.
holidays.funFact: Cherry pie became America's go-to dessert after cherries were introduced to North America in the 1600s.

holidays.name: Raw Food Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to explore eating uncooked and unprocessed foods for better health and vitality.
holidays.origin: An unofficial health lifestyle observance meant to raise awareness about raw food benefits.
holidays.funFact: Raw food diets date back thousands of years, but February 20 celebrates the modern movement embracing it.
